instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332-A 4sns/1/c000008 ts0p--124
threads.message:
some liquid sign on the screen caused by cleaning but clean MLB, fan spinning fast, got ultrasonic clean but still error.
where to start?

threads.title: 820-3332-A 4sns/1/c000008 ts0p--124
threads.message: TS0p is trackpad sensor. Bad cable/connector probably.

threads.title: 820-3332-A 4sns/1/c000008 ts0p--124
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10540"]TS0p is trackpad sensor. Bad cable/connector probably.[/QUOTE]
Thought so, I tested with other trackpad but stil the same, checking cable tomorrow.. thanks.

threads.title: 820-3332-A 4sns/1/c000008 ts0p--124
threads.message: Well, replaced both the trackpad and the cable and still getting TS0P

threads.title: 820-3332-A 4sns/1/c000008 ts0p--124
threads.message: Run ASD and see if there are more errors. The ALS/Webcam are on the same bus as the trackpad sensor, so disconnect that and inspect the connector for corrosion.
